day-1.title: DAY 1 - Understanding Happiness vs. Pleasure
day-1.quote: Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within.
day-1.author: -Eckhart Tolle

day-2.title: DAY 2 - Dealing with Strong Emotions
day-2.quote: "Slow breathing is like an anchor in the midst of an emotional storm: the anchor won't make the storm go away, but it will hold you steady until it passes."
day-2.author: - Russ Harris

day-3.title: DAY 3 - Is it true? Am I More Fun When I Drink?
day-3.quote: Confidence isn't 'I'm fun because I'm drinking.' Confidence is 'I'm fun because I'm me.'
day-3.author: - Anonymous

day-4.title: DAY 4 - Celebrating Gratitude
day-4.quote: It's not joy that makes us grateful, it's gratitude that makes us joyful.
day-4.author: - David Steindl-Rast

day-5.title: DAY 5 - Your Sleep Is Getting Better (And So Are You)
day-5.quote: Sleep is the golden chain that ties health and our bodies together.
day-5.author: - Thomas Dekker

day-6.title: DAY 6 - The Differences between Guilt and Shame
day-6.quote: We cannot grow when we are in shame, and we can't use shame to change ourselves or others.
day-6.author: -Brené Brown

day-7.title: DAY 7 - How to Use Grounding Techniques to Stay Present
day-7.quote: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing, the next best thing is the wrong thing, and the worst thing you can do is nothing.
day-7.author: - Theodore Roosevelt

day-8.title: DAY 8 - Chess: The Game of MyDry30
day-8.quote: Patience is not simply the ability to wait, it's how we behave while we're waiting.
day-8.author: -Joyce Meyer

day-9.title: DAY 9 - Alcohol and Sugar: The Not-So-Dynamic Duo
day-9.quote: The food you eat can be either the safest and most powerful form of medicine or the slowest form of poison.
day-9.author: -Ann Wigmore

day-10.title: DAY 10 - Navigating Alcohol Withdrawal Symptoms
day-10.quote: You are not broken. You are not a problem to be solved. Healing happens naturally when we create the right conditions.
day-10.author: - Unknown

day-11.title: DAY 11 - Cravings, Triggers, and Sneaky Signals
day-11.quote: First you take a drink, then the drink takes a drink, then the drink takes you.
day-11.author: -F. Scott Fitzgerald

day-12.title: DAY 12 - Riding the Waves: How to Master Urge Surfing With Ease
day-12.quote: You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
day-12.author: -Jon Kabat-Zinn

day-13.title: DAY 13 - A Day of Kindness
day-13.quote: No one has ever become poor by giving.
day-13.author: -Anne Frank

day-14.title: DAY 14 - How to (Re)Build Self-Esteem Through Sobriety
day-14.quote: Owning our story and loving ourselves through that process is the bravest thing that we will ever do.
day-14.author: -Brené Brown

day-15.title: DAY 15 - Practicing Patience in an Impatient World
day-15.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
day-15.author: -Confucius

day-16.title: DAY 16 - Breaking Free from Peer Pressure
day-16.quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
day-16.author: -Ralph Waldo Emerson

day-17.title: DAY 17 - The Science Behind Habits
day-17.quote: First we make our habits, then our habits make us.
day-17.author: -Charles C. Noble

day-18.title: DAY 18 - The Power of Hypnotherapy and Journaling to Change Drinking Habits
day-18.quote: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
day-18.author: ⁠-Carl Jung

day-19.title: DAY 19 - The Power of Forgiveness
day-19.quote: Forgiveness doesn't make the other person right, it makes you free.
day-19.author: - Stormie Omartian

day-20.title: DAY 20 - How to Overcome Your Fears and Use Them to Grow
day-20.quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
day-20.author: -Nelson Mandela

day-21.title: DAY 21 - Moving Beyond Labels and Embracing Your True Self
day-21.quote: The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages.
day-21.author: - Virginia Woolf

day-22.title: DAY 22 - How to Move Beyond Denial and Embrace Truth Instead
day-22.quote: The worst lies are the lies we tell ourselves.
day-22.author: -Richard Bach

day-23.title: DAY 23 - Why Honesty Is Important On Your Journey Without Alcohol
day-23.quote: In the future I will not fear the truth, because the more it is postponed, the more difficult it is to confront.
day-23.author: -Jorge Luis Borges

day-24.title: DAY 24 - How to Practice the Art of Self-Compassion
day-24.quote: Self-compassion is simply giving the same kindness to ourselves that we would give to others.
day-24.author: -Kristin Neff

day-25.title: DAY 25 - Alcohol and Blood Pressure: A Not-So-Healthy Relationship
day-25.quote: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
day-25.author: -Jim Rohn

day-26.title: DAY 26 - Exploring Social Relationships and Intimacy Without Alcohol
day-26.quote: Connection is why we're here; it is what gives purpose and meaning to our lives.
day-26.author: -Brené Brown

day-27.title: DAY 27 - How to Live Life Hangover-Free (And Actually Enjoy It)
day-27.quote: The best way to take care of the future is to take care of the present moment
day-27.author: - Thich Nhat Hanh

day-28.title: DAY 28 - Finding Balance: Internal vs External Stress
day-28.quote: Stress is not what happens to us. It's our response to what happens. And response is something we can choose.
day-28.author: -Maureen Killoran

day-29.title: DAY 29 - Core Values and Your UM Journey
day-29.quote: Your beliefs become your thoughts, your thoughts become your words, your words become your actions, your actions become your habits, your habits become your values, your values become your destiny.
day-29.author: -Mahatma Gandhi

day-30.title: DAY 30 - Your Choice: Moderation or Cessation?
day-30.quote: Thirty days ago you made a decision. Today you're living proof that you can keep your word to yourself.
day-30.author: -Unknown
